title: Generic enum in @MappedSuperclass fails in Quarkus 3.0.0.CR2

labels.name: triage/upstream
labels.description: Used for issues which are caused by issues in upstream projects/dependency

body:
### Describe the bug

Using a generic type in an abstract `@MappedSuperclass` results in an `java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Named type [interface root.EnumBase] did not implement BasicType nor UserType` exception on statup.

This "used to work" in Quarkus 2.x / Hibernate 5.x, where at least the `SessionFactory` was built. However, there seems to be an issue with the dirty check when **only** the property of the `@MappedSuperclass` is updated ~~via **methods of the  `@MappedSuperclass`** but *not* methods of the child class~~.

### Expected behavior

All tests pass in Quarkus 2.x and 3.x (Hibernate 5.x, 6.x)

### Actual behavior

#### Quarkus 3.x / Hibernate 6.x

The test throws the following exception:


#### Quarkus 2.x / Hibernate 5.x

Here, the 

### How to Reproduce?

To reproduce the error:

1. Check out the `genericTests` branch of this repository: https://github.com/mensinda/quarkus-stuff/tree/genericTests
2. run `mvn clean verify`

To see that it "used to work" in Quarkus 2.x:

1. run `./downgrade.sh`
2. run `mvn clean verify`

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

Linux 5.15.0-56-generic #62-Ubuntu SMP Tue Nov 22 19:54:14 UTC 2022 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk version "17.0.6" 2023-01-17

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

3.0.0.CR2 / 2.16.6.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Apache Maven 3.8.2 (ea98e05a04480131370aa0c110b8c54cf726c06f)

### Additional information

_No response_
